description: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Brooke Rollins, head of the America First Policy Institute, to oversee the Department of Agriculture. She has a long history in conservative politics.
title: Trump taps Brooke Rollins of America First Policy Institute for agriculture secretary

description: A major storm dropped more snow and record rain in California, while on the opposite side of the country blizzard or winter storm warnings were in effect Saturday.
title: Winter storms sweep across the U.S. while a new system is expected for Thanksgiving

description: The cases appeared in California, Illinois, New Jersey and New York between July 31 and Oct. 24, the CDC said. Nine out of the 11 infected individuals were hospitalized.
title: Infant dies and 10 others sick in latest listeria outbreak tied to ready-to-eat meat

description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and the head of NATO, Mark Rutte, met on Friday in Palm Beach for talks on global security, the military alliance said Saturday.
title: NATO head and Trump meet in Florida for talks on global security

description: Over 12 million cases of dengue fever were reported in 2024, the most ever. A study suggests climate change has likely played a significant role in the disease's expansion.
title: Climate change plays a role in global rise of dengue fever

description: NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the death of ballet dancer Vladimir Shklyarov. Reports from Russian media say he fell from a 5th floor balcony.
title: Opinion: Remembering Vladimir Shklyarov, a dancer for the people

description: A heart cockle shell has been found to let in light through a design that resembles fiber optic cables. This could inspire everything from helping coral survive to designing new camera lenses.
title: What a mollusc shell and fiber optic cables have in common

description: Thanksgiving favorites such as mac and cheese, turkey and casseroles can be brought through TSA checkpoints. But cranberry sauce, maple syrup and gravy must go in checked baggage, the agency says.
title: Bringing Thanksgiving food on a plane? Here is what you should know

description: Surviving on a diet of toothpaste and toilet paper, South Africa's notorious "zama-zama" illegal miners continue a weeks-long standoff with police in the darkness of a disused gold mine.
title: South Africa's illegal gold miners are locked in an underground standoff with police

description: The strikes were the fourth on Beirut in less than a week. The escalation comes after a U.S. envoy traveled to the region this week in an attempt to broker a cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah.
title: At least 11 killed in Israeli strikes in Beirut as diplomats push for cease-fire

description: In recent years, "atmospheric river" has become used much more frequently in scientific papers and in media coverage. According to experts who study climate and weather, a few reasons may explain why.
title: Atmospheric rivers aren't new. Why does it feel like we're hearing about them more?

description: NATO and Ukraine will hold emergency talks Tuesday after Russia attacked the city of Dnipro with an experimental, hypersonic ballistic missile that escalated the nearly 33-month-old war.
title: NATO and Ukraine to hold emergency talks after Russia's attack with new missile

description: In a flurry of picks on Friday evening, Trump named three choices for top health jobs. Together they would help the incoming president shift the priorities of agencies that are key to public health.
title: What to know about Trump's picks for CDC, FDA and surgeon general

description: The storm arrived in the Pacific Northwest earlier this week, killing two people and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands, mostly in the Seattle area, before moving through Northern California.
title: Storm lashes Northern California after leaving thousands without power in Seattle
